main.name: Erick Pena
main.description: I am a highly motivated professional with a strong Computer Science background. Seeking to pursue a new position with room for advancement alongside a growing team
main.bio: I am an enthusiastic professional with a great passion for programming. I graduated from the University of Central Florida in the year 2020 with a bachelor’s degree in computer science. I have been in the workforce for more than a year now and I have come to realize that there is a whole world that is yet to be explored. Many opportunities in this amazing field make me see the future with excitement. Apart from programming some of the activities that keep me busy are learning to play the guitar and taking Portuguese lessons. Feel free to check my work and if you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: This is the institute where I was able to solidify many of my skills. Some of my favorite courses I have taken are parallel computing, computer graphics, and artificial intelligence. Also, during my time here I have been part of the Dean’s List on multiple occasions for maintaining a GPA above 3.8.
This is the first school I attended toward my degree and where I learned most of my programming fundamentals.

work.title: Software Engineer Analyst
descriptions: Worked with technical team to maintain application that is used to provide services and solutions to more than 2 million businesses
Tested software before deployment for bugs, speed, and efficiently reducing the number of reported complaints by 14%
Created additional training material to help new co-workers accelerate their training process from 3 to 2 weeks; the training material is still in use to this day, and it has helped 15+ employees

work.title: Software Developer
descriptions: Developed cryptocurrency using DAG technology which helped to improve the number of transactions from 4 to 230 transactions per second from previous blockchain implementation
Develop set of APIs to connect gaming mobile app to cryptocurrency network to distribute 100,000+ virtual coins to users who successfully complete augmented-reality challenges
Recognized by UCF’s CECS showcase as an innovative project and made an appearance in local news

work.title: Computer Science and Math Tutor
descriptions: Worked closely with UCF students to provide supplemental tutoring
Elaborated different lesson plans to accommodate students at different levels and improve the effectiveness
Tutored courses such as Data Structures and Algorithms, Intro to C programming, OOP, and Calculus

work.title: Attraction Operator
descriptions: Deliver top-quality customer service in a professional manner while managing multiple tasks
Ensure the proper use of safety practices and procedures while operating the attraction
Evaluate and communicate with co-workers to meet goals and accomplish tasks

projects.title: Contacts Manger
projects.description: This is a friendly responsive website that allows you to store all of your contacts in an organized and concise manner. The application allows login, registration, and CRUD operations. This project was developed with MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js.

projects.title: Weather 24/7
projects.description: This is a responsive website that allows users to check forecasts and news of their current location and any other city of their choice. The website will make use of third-party APIs to gather all the required information and display it in a friendly and organized manner. This project was developed with React.js and Node.js.

projects.title: SQL-GUI
projects.description: This is a Java-based GUI application that will connect to your MySQL server via JDBC allowing you to run SQL queries and have a visual representation of your data. The application was developed with Java, Java-Swing, and SQL.

projects.title: Character Keep
projects.description: This is part of a group project where the application is responsible to generate, collect, and save data from tabletop games such as Warhammer. I was in charge to create the mobile component of the interactive application on Android with the use of Java and SQL.

projects.title: 3D Cell Model
projects.description: This is an interactive 3d project that allows users to navigate, explore, and learn the anatomy of an animal cell. The user is able to pinpoint a particular area of the cell and learn how an individual component works. This project was developed in JavaScript with the help of Three.js, HTML, CSS, and Vectary.

projects.title: Atlantic Trails Resort
projects.description: This is a friendly responsive website used as the main online tool to represent a vacation Resort. The website allows the user to contact the resort and navigate through the activities offered throughout the day. The project was developed with the use of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.

projects.title: PL/0 Compiler
projects.description: PL/0 is a compiler built-in C  that is able to read instructions character by character detecting any syntax errors, parsing it, and outputting results from many logistics operations that the program is able to perform.

projects.title: Durable Queue for Non-Volatile Memory:
projects.description: This is part of a published research report that explains the scalability from the implementation of a durable queue for non-volatile memory created by my colleagues and me. This project is developed in Java.

projects.title: React Native Login System
projects.description: This is an example of a project that I decided to create to explore and learn more about React Native. To authenticate users I am using Google's Firebase tools to get familiar with their authentication system.
